text: Find out more about the situation from Asta

title: Mission Description
content: Himeko, who helped you before, has finally made her appearance. Her relaxed and confident posture almost makes you forget about the fact that they're also outsiders who were dragged into this crisis. At this point, only Asta, the acting lead researcher of the space station, knows whether the crisis has been adverted...

text:
(Listen to the Distressed Researcher, optional)
(Approach researcher, idle text)

speaker: Distressed Researcher
line: I'm still young. I don't wanna die!

speaker: Distressed Researcher
line: Why did the Antimatter Legion suddenly come here? I don't wanna die here! Mom, dad, my sweet angel... I miss you so much.

speaker: Distressed Researcher
line: I, I'm too young to die! I've got things I still want to achieve on this space station.

speaker: Rocky
line: Lesley ! Sir, I need to go. I need to go find Lesley.

speaker: Bernard
line: Stupid boy, is your head not screwed on right? You're leaving over my dead body.

speaker: Bernard
line: I'll knock some sense into you yet... Hey, where do you think you're go— Argh...

speaker: Emily
line: Emily, calm down and think about what she would do in such a disaster. Ten cups of coffee? A pill? Or maybe hide in a room full of Mystic Scrolls of Aeons?

speaker: Emily
line: ...That's bitter coffee... *coughing* ...so bitter.

speaker: Emily
line: Too dang bitter!!!

speaker: Emily
line: Oh sis , where are you? I'm so scared...

speaker: Wen Shiling
line: *crying* What should we do!? They said there are monsters in the storage zone. And the gift I prepared for Master Capote is still in the analysis room of the Department of Implement Arts...

speaker: Adler
line: You know, there's loads of monsters attacking the space station this time, and some of them aren't even on the station's records—

speaker: Wen Shiling
line: *crying* You're so annoying, stop saying that! *crying*

speaker: Adler
line: Hey, how old are you? Don't be a baby!

speaker: Adler
line: Please stop crying. *gasp* How about I pretend to be a monster for you, huh?

speaker: Adler
line: Raaaawr!

speaker: Wen Shiling
line: Waaaah!

text:
(Listen to Anxious Researcher and Hamstrung Researcher, optional)
(Approach researchers, idle text)

speaker: Anxious Researcher
line: Is the report done?

speaker: Hamstrung Researcher
line: Ack, it's a long story.

speaker: Anxious Researcher
line: That report I asked you to write before... how is it?

speaker: Hamstrung Researcher
line: I finished it two days back, but y'know... well, it's a long story.

speaker: Anxious Researcher
line: So what exactly is going on?

speaker: Hamstrung Researcher
line: Just as we were running a seminar, the Antimatter Legion invaded. The old fella sitting in front of me was wounded in action, and I was scared half to death.

speaker: Anxious Researcher
line: Wow, that's rough. Thank goodness you're okay.

speaker: Hamstrung Researcher
line: Yeah, just a little unlucky. I need to re-write it.

speaker: Mare
line: That's right... that's right. "The resentful spirit's senseless obsession turns into a tangible hand, and the shadow of the old disaster will conceal the heavens!"

speaker: Mare
line: That's exactly what was written on the Mystic Scroll of Aeons. It refers to the followers of Nanook the Destruction using antimatter to create a galactic weapon of war.

speaker: Mare
line: I didn't think I'd be fortunate enough to witness... hehehehe...

speaker: Mare
line: Oh, have you also come to witness the power and miracle of the Aeons? Then go over there, there's a good spot right there.

speaker: Mare
line: Beware of any interferences from your mortal body when observing... you must seize every detail. When an Aeon appears, even the tiniest trace must not be missed. Hehehe...

speaker: Gunn
line: You see that, Sheila? History always repeats itself.

speaker: Sheila
line: History? Gunn, this is the first time I have witnessed the space station in such disarray.

speaker: Gunn
line: Oh Sheila, when we face another dire crisis like this, if you're able to rescue your home planet... Will you come back and save us?

speaker: Sheila
line: Home planet? My home planet? ...I do not understand what you are saying.

speaker: Gunn
line: Never mind. If Sheila could hear this, she'd understand.

speaker: Lukacs
line: We researchers have all taken refuge here, but has anyone given any thought to the non-human life on this space station?

speaker: Lukacs
line: They may be part of the rare item collection, but are they not also living things? Don't their rights deserve to be protected!?

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: Yes. Non. Human. Life. Living creatures that aren't human...

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: ...Some of which have been collected as rare items and housed in the space station. Most of the researchers disregard their basic rights.

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: Even now, with death staring them in the face, they still refuse to open their minds.

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: And I, Lukacs, outstanding researcher of the Herta Department of Galactic Geopolitics, must awaken those pretending to sleep!

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: At the space station, we've always collected rare items — countless articles from across the galaxy. But not everyone knows that among these articles are also living things.

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: And I, Lukacs, outstanding researcher of the Herta Department of Galactic Geopolitics, must emphasize in this time of crisis that their lives and rights should also be respected!

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: Exactly! And I, Lukacs, outstanding researcher of the Herta Department of Galactic Geopolitics, shall continue fighting and speaking up for the rights of all non-human life in these terrible times!

speaker: Lukacs
line: If you are interested in joining the cause, please stand by my side and repeat after me!

speaker: Lukacs
line: Protect rare item rights! Save non-human life!

speaker: Lukacs
line: All together! Protect rare item rights...!

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: You did well, friend! Follow my rhythm, and say it loud, with conviction!

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: Perfect, my friend. Now let us work together and invite more supporters to join us!

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: Hmph! Just another egocentric anthropocentrist!

children.speaker: Lukacs
children.line: Open your benighted eyes and look at the delicate life around you!

speaker: Lukacs
line: Protect rare item rights! Save non-human life!

speaker: Asta
line: Projectile radar tracking, normal. Telemetry signal frequency unusually high! Maintain at normal levels!

speaker: Asta
line: Our measurements predict that the Legion is about to unleash over ten waves of continuous attacks. Everyone, brace yourselves!

speaker: March 7th
line: Asta! We're back!

speaker: Asta
line: Whew, I'm glad you're all back safe. Arlan just told me about the situation at the storage zone — and about his injury... thank you, for all your help.

speaker: Asta
line: In times of disaster, I realize more and more that the space station's researchers are its most valuable assets... Alas, we were ill-prepared for such emergencies... we should have built up our security and combat departments.

speaker: Asta
line: On the other hand, the entire crew of the Astral Express seems to be extraordinarily skilled.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What is the current situation on the space station?

speaker: Asta
line: The situation is under control for now. The damage to our security system was minor. The intruder only managed to alter a small amount of data, so it was easy to fix.

speaker: Asta
line: The real problem lies with the researchers... They trust Madam Herta wholeheartedly and never thought that the space station would be breached by the Legion. A broken spirit is far worse than a broken body.

speaker: Himeko
line: Let's go speak with the researchers. Right now, the space station can't afford any more unexpected turns, especially from within. Have you tried contacting Herta?

speaker: Asta
line: I sent multiple letters, all met with silence. You know her, Himeko, the space station is but a mere warehouse for followers and rare items. She doesn't really care about it.

speaker: Himeko
line: I knew it... No matter. I'll also send a letter to Herta and tell her that we've brought the rare item she seeks. At least that might get her attention.

speaker: Asta
line: That would be of great help.

title: Step Description
content: The space station's external crisis seems to be under control but the researchers remain uneasy. Not sure how Arlan is doing. Let's go check on him.

text: Warp to obtain characters and Light Cones

html_content:
(Interactive tutorial)
Open Warp
You can obtain characters and Light Cones from Warps.
Make 1 Warp.
(Obtain Asta)

speaker: Asta
line: ▶ Hello, you must be... (Trailblazer), right? How can I help you?

text: I'd like to learn about the space station.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: This is Herta Space Station . As you might tell from its name, it belongs to the distinguished Madam Herta herself.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Herta Space Station was originally built as a warehouse for rare items and relics, but Madam Herta also allowed her followers to oversee tasks and conduct research. It then gradually turned into a scientific research base.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: The storage zone you passed through contains all our inventory, and is the main research center.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: The master control zone where we are now is the control center of the whole space station.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: It is said that the space station also contains Madam Herta's private chamber where her most precious, rare, and dangerous collections are sealed... And for someone like her, it's not out of the realm of possibility.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Even from me, the lead researcher, there are many things she keeps secret.

text: I'd like to learn about you.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: I'm lead researcher of Herta Space Station. But honestly... I'm more like Madam Herta's "housekeeper" of this place.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Madam Herta is a genius, but managing disparate staff, tactfully representing the space station before the Intelligentsia Guild ... these are all things beyond her abilities. But as it turns out they are my forte.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Hehe, scholars are a lot easier to deal with than those vociferous old geezers back at home.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: No matter how much they drone on about "Astronomy is just about looking at things, it doesn't bring any real value," they all fall silent in front of Madam Herta.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: No matter the problem, you just needed to say that it was Madam Herta's wishes and all would be fine. After all, Herta herself is a symbol of wisdom.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Hey, thanks to her, I can count the stars to sleep. Otherwise, I would've had to take over the family fortune. Just thinking about it terrifies me.

text: I'd like to learn about Arlan.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Arlan went to dress his wounds at the rest area. He knows himself well... but if he insists on pushing his limits, I'll give him a good earful.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: I'm very upset he didn't obey my orders and insisted on searching the storage zone even though everyone had already evacuated.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: I know he didn't want to leave any researchers behind... The Security Department is more than just a job to him.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: But Arlan doesn't care about getting hurt, he only cares about protecting others. It's the only way he feels... fulfilled.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: And it's not that I don't understand where he's coming from. I just want him to look out for himself, too!

text: I'd like to learn about Herta.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Herta... she's a member of the Genius Society . One of the proud favorites of the Aeon of Erudition . Ever since the birth of Nous , there have only been 84 people admitted into the Genius Society.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: That is why Madam Herta is extremely... headstrong... She only pursues what interests her and as soon as that interest is lost, she abandons it and moves on. The space station was one such abandoned interest...

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Anyway, I lent out one of her manuscripts as a resource reference not long ago. It should still be in the master control zone. You can take a look if you wish.

text: I don't have any more questions.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Huh, chatting with you seems to have lightened my mood. It seems like talking can really raise one's spirits.

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ What's the matter, (Trailblazer)? You seem to have something on your mind.

text: I'd like to learn about the Astral Express.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Basically speaking, it's a train that travels through space. But more specifically, the Astral Express was a creation of the Aeon, Akivili the Trailblazer .

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: As for what the Trailblaze, the Aeons, and Akivili are all about, let's talk about it when things have calmed down a little. I don't wanna overwhelm you now, do I?

text: I'd like to learn about Light Cones .

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Light Cones were created by the Garden of Recollection . These followers of the Aeon of Remembrance refined memory fragments to create Light Cones, which preserve memories.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: But you've already realized it, haven't you? Since Light Cones can preserve memories, they can also preserve experiences and abilities. That's why Light Cones are extremely precious rare items under level-2 restriction by the Interastral Peace Corporation .

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: As far as I know, only the IPC possesses Light Cone technology authorized by the Garden of Recollection. I couldn't say what deal Herta made with the Garden, but knowing her, it was likely off the books...

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: You should cherish every Light Cone. They are all precious memories of their original owners.

text: Do you... know who I am?

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Who exactly you are escapes me, but you seem familiar to me.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: I have a couple of hunches, but I can't prove any at this point. So, they'll be my little secrets for now.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Are you concerned about your past? You seem like someone who prefers to look forward rather than back... Or maybe I'm just describing myself.

text: I don't have any more questions.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Come to me anytime if you have more questions.

speaker: Asta
line: I'll leave the reassurance of the researchers in your hands.

speaker: Asta
line: If you have any other questions, you are welcome to come to Himeko and me.

speaker: Arlan
line: ...If only I'd caught the Antimatter Legion sooner...

children.speaker: Arlan
children.line: I'm fine, this pain is nothing, really. I'm used to it. In fact, I should be proud of it. It's a reminder of being able to protect everyone.

children.speaker: Arlan
children.line: Ahem, but don't tell Lead Researcher Asta what I just said.

children.speaker: Arlan
children.line: There were a few researchers who didn't make it...

children.speaker: Arlan
children.line: The rest are fine, mostly minor injuries. But I'm worried about their mental states.

children.speaker: Arlan
children.line: Most of them came to the space station because they admired Madam Herta. But now they can't reach her or even their own families. I just hope they can all survive this crisis.

children.speaker: Arlan
children.line: My first impression was that she was the daughter of a rich family — owners of a big company.

children.speaker: Arlan
children.line: She was kind to me though. When she went to the space station, I followed her.

children.speaker: Arlan
children.line: I don't know much about science, but I'm glad to be able to protect people in pursuit of their research.

text: Alright, I'll leave you to get some rest.

children.speaker: Arlan
children.line: I hope all this chaos will end soon.

text: Search for other researchers that need help

title: Step Description
content: The space station's external crisis seems to be under control but the researchers remain uneasy.Many of them were alone when they came here. What do they care about the most now? The space station? Their colleagues? Or is it the research itself?It's obvious that everyone's answer is different.

speaker: Eikura Shuu
line: Why did those monsters have to breach the ionizing grid on my watch...

speaker: Eikura Shuu
line: It can't be my fault, I'd never make a mistake like this... I'm going out there to check the data again!

children.speaker: Eikura Shuu
children.line: Injured? I don't care, see anyone else that cares? Who are you anyway, get out of my way.

children.speaker: Eikura Shuu
children.line: Dangerous? Of course it's dangerous, I just came back from the front line, I know that better than you.

children.speaker: Eikura Shuu
children.line: Hero? Don't overthink it. I'm not doing this for others, I'm doing it for myself.

speaker: Eikura Shuu
line: The space station shield's first line of defense is the anti-gravity ionizing grid. I'm the researcher in charge of it. Do you expect me to just sit here after something like this?

children.speaker: Eikura Shuu
children.line: I agree. But when the investigation's over, the blame will fall entirely on my shoulders.

children.speaker: Eikura Shuu
children.line: That may be the case, but it's better than just hiding here doing nothing.

children.speaker: Eikura Shuu
children.line: Hmph... it's easy for you to say! This didn't happen on your watch, you wouldn't understand!

speaker: Eikura Shuu
line: Besides, that bunch of troublemakers is still out there... I know you mean well, but I've made up my mind.

speaker: Hinkel
line: Push the stick down, Alfred... Sorry, sorry, I got the wrong person.

speaker: Hinkel
line: Thanks, kid. We're doing some pre-checks for the satellite remote sensing. I'll hold down the button to monitor the signal, and you push the control stick according to my instructions.

speaker: Hinkel
line: But first let's talk about the controls. "Up" is the spectrometer, "Down" is the filter, "Left" is the reference level, and "Right" is the attenuator.

speaker: Hinkel
line: Our pre-checks have three steps. Turning on the spectrometer, then the attenuator, and finally outputting the signal to the filter.

speaker: Hinkel
line: It's quite a bit to remember... You got everything?

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: Don't worry, I'll go over it again.

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: The controls are "Up" for the spectrometer, "Down" for the filter, "Left" for the reference level, and "Right" for the attenuator.

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: The pre-checks have three steps. Turning on the spectrometer, then the attenuator, and finally outputting the signal to the filter.

speaker: Hinkel
line: Are you ready? Three, two, one...

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: Wrong order, kid. Let me demonstrate.

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: Push the control stick up to activate the spectrometer, then right for the attenuator, and finally down for the filter.

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: Wrong order, kid. Let me demonstrate.

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: Push the control stick up to activate the spectrometer, then right for the attenuator, and finally down for the filter.

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: Wonderful, thank you.

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: That was very helpful of you, kid. Alfred was the researcher in charge of this — he was in the storage zone earlier... He didn't make it back.

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: Abraham was close to him. I don't know how to tell him about it...

children.speaker: Hinkel
children.line: The top priority is to preserve the space station and concentrate on the work at hand.

speaker: Abraham
line: I need to leave, I need to run from this forsaken...

speaker: Abraham
line: No, it's impossible. I can run from yesterday, I can run from today, but tomorrow will always be one step ahead of me...

speaker: Abraham
line: Look, the obstacle detection terminal has recorded 142,856 attacks... the next count will be 142,857!

speaker: Abraham
line: I know in my heart that when I see that hopelessly beautiful cyclic number... it will mean the poetic end of my life's cycle.

children.speaker: Abraham
children.line: Everyone keeps saying that. "Things will get better, things won't always be this bad."

children.speaker: Abraham
children.line: Negative... positive... A negative of a negative is a positive.

children.text: Life is but a path to death, but not today.

children.speaker: Abraham
children.line: Life is but a path to death, but not today... How insightful. Yes, of course! The closer you approach death, the more you appreciate life.

children.speaker: Abraham
children.line: I will pull myself together. Thank you, that was kind of you.

text: Life is but a path to death, but not today.

children.speaker: Abraham
children.line: How insightful, yes of course. The closer you approach death, the more you appreciate life.

children.speaker: Abraham
children.line: I will pull myself together. Thank you, that was kind of you.

text: Continue to look around the master control zone and report to Asta

title: Step Description
content: The space station's external crisis seems to be under control. If there are places you haven't been to yet, now's the chance to go and take a look.Once everything has been taken care of, go and report to Asta.

text: Participate in various events to obtain corresponding rewards

html_content:
(Interactive tutorial)
Open the Travel Log to see the events that are currently happening.
Complete objectives in the Travel Log to receive corresponding rewards.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Take the Express and leave.

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: I'll stay.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: But...

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Let's go.

speaker: Asta
line: The supply zone 's defense shield won't hold much longer. You all need to hurry...

speaker: Asta
line: I'll be here, you've got to fend them off...

speaker: Asta
line: You... hurry...

speaker: Himeko
line: ...We lost communications.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Are you thinking of going back? Let me remind you, that's the Doomsday Beast , the Legion's planet destroyer.

speaker: Himeko
line: The space station is Herta's creation. As long as a Lord Ravager doesn't intervene, there should be no problems.

speaker: March 7th
line: B—But we can't just run away like this, right...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The Doomsday Beast can rip off the defense shield like tearing paper — and Herta's not here. The station's defenses are too weak to stand against the Antimatter Legion.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Either way, the Legion has the blessing of the Aeon, Nanook . They came prepared and everyone here is not.

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ That's why we have to leave and take (Trailblazer) with us.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ (Trailblazer)?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ ( He's / She's ) ... that important?

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ ( He's / She's ) the one who can help us turn the tides... Of course, I may be wrong.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...As you say so. Alright, what should we do next?

speaker: Himeko
line: This is the supply zone where the maintenance crew works. There's a path here that leads to the nearest railway platform. Let's head over there and meet up with Welt .

speaker: March 7th
line: Mr. Yang? Mr. Yang's here too? Didn't he stay on the Express?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The Astral Express tracks our coordinates in real time... And with such a huge change in the space station's movements, there's no way Mr. Yang wouldn't have noticed.

speaker: Himeko
line: Hmm, I can almost guarantee that your Mr. Yang is already on his way.

speaker: Himeko
line: Right now, we might be able to handle things if it's just the Doomsday Beast. But, if the Destruction's Emanator were to appear...

text: I still feel that things won't be going as planned.

speaker: Himeko
line: Let's hurry up and get out of here. I'll explain later.
